data.title: 15 scenic waterfalls near Cleveland
data.text:
Photo by Lisa DeJong, The Plain Dealer

These Northeast Ohio waterfalls are thrilling to visit any time of year, and most of them are found in the park systems in the Greater Cleveland area.

If you know of a waterfall that you think should be added to the list, tell us about it in the comments.

John Pana, cleveland.com

1

BRANDYWINE FALLS - Cuyahoga Valley National Park

This is one of the most popular attractions in the national park. The Brandywine Gorge Trail is a hiking trail that starts near the Inn at Brandywine Falls at the top of the waterfall and meanders down to the creek bed (see map below).

Brandywine Falls has a long, wooden boardwalk through the woods. One of the observation platforms is wheelchair-accessible.

- 65 feet high

- Very crowded in the summers from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.

- DIRECTIONS to Brandywine Falls (8176 Brandywine Road in Sagamore Hills Township, Ohio)

- National Park webpage for Brandywine Falls

- 30-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

National Park Service

Brandywine Falls in autumn

John Pana, cleveland.com

Brandywine Falls in the winter

John Pana, cleveland.com

View from the top of the falls

Note: Visitors are instructed to use caution and stay on the marked trails when exploring the waterfall. Falls could result in serious injury or even death.

Mike Rose, cleveland.com

Here's a quick video clip of Brandywine Falls

John Pana, cleveland.com

2

MILL CREEK FALLS - Cleveland Metroparks

This pleasant surprise in the Garfield Park Reservation is reported to be the tallest waterfall in Cuyahoga County.

- 48 feet tall

- Scenic overlook has an upper platform that is wheelchair-accessible, and a lower platform with stairs.

- DIRECTIONS to Mill Creek Falls

- Cleveland Metroparks' webpage for Mill Creek Falls

- 15-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

Mike Rose, cleveland.com

Here's a quick video clip of Mill Creek Falls

Cleveland Metroparks

Mill Creek Falls

Mill Creek Falls is located near the intersection of Broadway Avenue and Warner Road in Cleveland.

John Pana, cleveland.com

3

CHAGRIN FALLS

Chagrin Falls, located in the charming village of the same name, is the largest of several waterfalls on the Chagrin River. An ice cream and popcorn shop sits at the top of the falls, and a large wooden staircase leads down to a viewing deck that's so close to the falls you can feel the mist.

- 20 feet high

- Surrounded by shops, restaurants in Chagrin Falls village

- DIRECTIONS to Chagrin Falls

- 30-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

John Pana, cleveland.com

John Pana, cleveland.com

4

BLUE HEN FALLS - Cuyahoga Valley National Park

This waterfall is the first stop on a national park hiking trail that also includes Buttermilk Falls. The national park discourages swimming at the falls.

- 15 feet tall

- If it hasn't rained recently, this will be more of a trickle than a waterfall

- DIRECTIONS to the Blue Hen Falls trailhead and parking lot

- Conservancy for Cuyahoga Valley National Park webpage for Blue Hen Falls

- 30-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

Conservancy for Cuyahoga Valley National Park

Blue Hen Falls

John Pana, cleveland.com

5

GREAT FALLS OF TINKER'S CREEK - Cleveland Metroparks

This paved waterfall hike is on the Viaduct Park Loop Trail in the Bedford Reservation.

- 15 feet tall

- One of two waterfalls in the Bedford Reservation, along with Bridal Veil Falls

- DIRECTIONS to Great Falls of Tinker's Creek

- Cleveland Metroparks' webpage for the Great Falls of Tinker's Creek

- 25-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

John Pana, cleveland.com

Great Falls of Tinker's Creek

Thomas Ondrey, The Plain Dealer

Great Falls of Tinker's Creek

Cleveland Metroparks

The Great Falls of Tinker's Creek on the Viaduct Park Loop Trail

Mike Rose, cleveland.com

Video tour: Cleveland's 5 best waterfalls

John Pana, cleveland.com

6

BRIDAL VEIL FALLS - Cleveland Metroparks

This long, cascading waterfall is the exclamation point on the end of a hike through the Bedford Reservation. Take the wooden staircase from the Bridal Veil Falls parking lot, and walk through a part of the park where the pine trees make for a refreshing setting.

- Not very tall, but it cascades for several hundred feet

- Connects via a rough surface hiking trail to the Tinker's Creek Gorge Overlook, which is a National Natural Landmark

- DIRECTIONS to Bridal Veil Falls

- Cleveland Metroparks' webpage for Bridal Veil Falls

- 30-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

John Pana, cleveland.com

Bridal Veil Falls

Here's a quick video clip of Bridal Veil Falls

Cleveland Metroparks

Directions to Bridal Veil Falls

Park at the Bridal Veil Falls lot, then cross the street and follow the trail.

Kevin Vail via Lake Metroparks

7

PAINE FALLS - Lake Metroparks

This two-level, cascading waterfall is a short walk from the parking lot on a smooth trail that includes steps.

- 30 feet tall

- DIRECTIONS to Paine Falls

- Lake Metroparks webpage for Paine Falls

- 40-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

Jim Marquardt via Lake Metroparks

Paine Falls

D'Arcy Egan, The Plain Dealer

Paine Falls

D'Arcy Egan, The Plain Dealer

Paine Falls

Michael Sangiacomo, The Plain Dealer

8

CASCADE PARK - Lorain County Metro Parks

Cascade Park includes a pair of large waterfalls.

THE EAST FALLS OF THE BLACK RIVER

- 25 feet tall

- Features an observation deck, and a trail that leads into the gorge

THE WEST FALLS OF THE BLACK RIVER

- 35 feet tall

- Features an observation deck above the falls

- DIRECTIONS to Cascade Park

- Lorain County Metro Parks webpage for Cascade Park

- 40-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

Lorain County Metro Parks

East Falls of the Black River

Lorain County Metro Parks

West Falls of the Black River

The East and West Falls of the Black River

Tina Karle via Lake Metroparks

9

CHAIR FACTORY FALLS - Lake Metroparks

This great escape is connected to the Lake Metroparks' Greenway Corridor. The 0.3-mile Chair Factory Falls Trail is gravel and steep.

- 35 feet tall

- Parking available at the Environmental Learning Center

- DIRECTIONS to Chair Factory Falls

- Lake Metroparks' webpage for the Greenway Corridor and Chair Factory Falls

- 35-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

Lake Metroparks

Chair Factory Falls

Thomas Ondrey, The Plain Dealer

10

GORGE DAM - Summit Metro Parks

There are plans to remove the Gorge Dam for the overall health of the Cuyahoga River. The original Cuyahoga Falls waterfall would again be visible if the dam was removed and the water level receded, a Summit Metro Parks naturalist told cleveland.com.

For now, the Gorge Metro Park in Cuyahoga Falls still features a long staircase down to the base of this dam. After heavy rainfall or when snow melts, water can be seen surging down into the ravine.

The city of Cuyahoga Falls is named for the falls.

- 60 feet tall

- DIRECTIONS to Gorge Metro Park

- Summit Metro Parks' webpage for Gorge Metro Park

- 40-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

John Pana, cleveland.com

Gorge Dam

John Pana, cleveland.com

Gorge Dam

Summit Metro Parks

Parking for Gorge Dam

Park at the Gorge Metro Park lot and follow the trail to the dam.

See video of Northeast Ohio waterfalls in winter

John Kolar via Geauga Park District

11

AFFELDER FALLS - Geauga Park District

This great find is located in the West Woods park in Russell Township. Use the Affelder House entrance to the West Woods at 15139 Chillicothe Road, then follow the Affelder Link trail to the falls.

- 20 feet tall

- The West Woods park includes Ansel's Cave and primitive tent camping sites

- DIRECTIONS to Affelder Falls

- Geauga Park District's webpage for the West Woods

- 40-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

John Kolar via Geauga Park District

Affelder Falls

Jim Marquardt via Geauga Park District

Affelder Falls

Joshua Gunter, cleveland.com

12

BEREA FALLS - Cleveland Metroparks

The Berea Falls scenic overlook is connected to the All Purpose Trail in the Rocky River Reservation. There's a parking lot for visitors, and wheelchairs and strollers can access the overlook using the All Purpose Trail.

- Less than 10 feet tall

- DIRECTIONS to Berea Falls

- Cleveland Metroparks' webpage for the Berea Falls Scenic Overlook

- 25-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

John Pana, cleveland.com

Berea Falls

Frank Szekely via Lake Metroparks

13

STONEYBROOK FALLS - Lake Metroparks

A forest staircase leads down into the gorge where Stonybrook Falls is waiting in the Penitentiary Glen park. This secluded spot is accessible via the Gorge Rim Trail, which is less than a mile long.

- Less than 10 feet tall

- DIRECTIONS to the Penitentiary Glen Reservation

- Lake Metroparks' webpage for the Penitentiary Glen Reservation

- 30-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

Follow the Gorge Rim Loop trail for Stoneybrook Falls

Peter Krouse, cleveland.com

14

DOAN BROOK FALLS - Cleveland

Doan Brook Falls is part of the Doan Brook Watershed, which is a green ribbon of parkway between Fairhill Road and North Park Boulevard in Cleveland. The falls can be seen from the Lake-to-Lakes Trail, which runs along the southern edge of Doan Brook.

- 10 feet tall

- Urban waterfall

- There's a trail leading down toward the falls, but hike at your own risk

- DIRECTIONS to Doan Brook Falls

- Doan Brook Watershed Partnership webpage

- 15-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

Peter Krouse, cleveland.com

Doan Brook Falls

Parking for Doan Brook Falls

Parking is available on Kemper Road. From there, cross Fairhill and turn right.

Doan Brook is between University Circle and Shaker Square

Photo: Cleveland Metroparks via clevelandmetroparks.com

15

BUTTERMILK FALLS - Cleveland Metroparks

The Buttermilk Falls scenic overlook can be found in the North Chagrin Reservation. It's part of the Buttermilk Falls Loop trail which leads to the North Chagrin Nature Center and is great for cross-country skiing in the winter.

- 15 feet tall

- Water flow is typically moderate. Consider coming after a rain or snow melt

- DIRECTIONS to Buttermilk Falls North Chagrin Reservation

- The Cleveland Metroparks' webpage for Buttermilk Falls Scenic Overlook

- 30-minute drive from downtown Cleveland

Buttermilk Falls Scenic Overlook in the North Chagrin Reservation

Exploring Cleveland's great outdoors

To explore hiking, biking, camping and more in Northeast Ohio's park systems, check out these video tours of Cleveland's great outdoors.

Photo top left: Lisa DeJong, The Plain Dealer; Photo top right: Roger Mastroanni

Exploring Cleveland's major attractions
